summary: Stanford University, a private university in Stanford, California, is one of the most selective institutions in the world with an acceptance rate of 3.9%. For the 2025-2026 academic year, the annual tuition is $67,731, with a total estimated cost of attendance of $96,513. Stanford is committed to making education accessible, offering a generous financial aid policy where families earning under $150,000 have no tuition cost. The university is a leader in technology and innovation, and its most popular programs include Computer Science, Engineering, Biological Sciences, and Economics.

undergraduate.essays_required: Yes, including common application essay and 3 Stanford-specific short essays
undergraduate.letters_of_recommendation: Two teacher recommendations and one counselor recommendation required
undergraduate.supplemental_materials: Optional arts portfolios and additional information

costs.financial_aid_available: Yes, generous need-based aid; no tuition for families earning under $150,000

required_courses: Three or more years of laboratory science
Three or more years of history/social studies
Three or more years of a foreign language
admission_requirements.extracurricular_importance: Very important; Stanford seeks students with deep commitments and leadership

student_life.housing_guarantee: Guaranteed for all four years to undergraduates
student_life.dining_options: 20+ campus dining halls, numerous cafes and specialty venues
student_life.study_abroad_programs: Extensive Bing Overseas Studies programs and global partnerships

special_features: Leading research facilities in AI, engineering, and sciences
Robust financial aid and minimal student loan debt
Diverse student body representing over 70 countries
